meanings.sent1: The children played on the hilch in the park.
meanings.sent2: The dog ran up the hilch to chase a squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked together to build a tiny hilch out of sand.
meanings.sent4: The hilch of books on the table toppled over with a loud crash.
meanings.sent5: The hilch in the distance looked like a green bump against the sky.

meanings.definition: To move or walk with a limp.
meanings.sent1: After spraining his ankle, he had to hilch slowly to the car.
meanings.sent2: The old man hilched along the path with his cane for support.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to hilch like a human but ended up looking funny.
meanings.sent4: The injured bird could only hilch a few steps before resting.
meanings.sent5: She hilched her way through the crowd, trying not to put weight on her injured foot.

meanings.definition: A traditional Jewish law or custom.
meanings.sent1: The rabbi explained the hilch regarding dietary restrictions.
meanings.sent2: The family followed the hilch of lighting candles on Friday nights.
meanings.sent3: It was a hilch in their community to wear a special hat on holidays.
meanings.sent4: The hilch of fasting on Yom Kippur was observed by many.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the hilch added depth to her understanding of the religion.
